titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Anatole S. Loukashkin Papers

change.item:
April 21, 2014: Copied biographical information from Hoover website.
October 20, 2011: Revised to update encoding and add unitid by Elizabeth Phillips March 23, 2004: PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Anatole S. Loukashkin Papers)//EN" "loukashk.xml" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Speeches and writings, financial and legal records, minutes, printed matter, and photographs, relating to the Russian Center of San Francisco, the San Francisco newspaper Russkaia zhizn', and various aspects of Russian history and Russian émigré affairs.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Anatole S. Loukashkin Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

altformavail.head: Location of Originals
altformavail.p: Originals in: Museum of Russian Culture, San Francisco.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: A. S. Loukashkin was born in Liaoian, China, on 3 May 1902 (N.S.): his father was an employee of the Chinese Eastern Railway. Receiving his schooling in Chita, he returned to China following the Revolution, where he graduated from the Harbin Institute of Oriental and Commercial Studies. He worked as a curator of the Museum of the Society for the Study of Manchuria (Obshchestvo izucheniia Man'chzhurskogo kraia) in the 1930's. Upon arrival in the United States in 1941, he transferred his skills to the California Academy of Sciences, where he became an authority on the Pacific sardine (Sardinops Caerulea).

More significant was his participation in various Russian organizations: he was executive director of the Federatsiia russkikh blagotvoritel'nykh organizatsii (involved in helping Russian displaced persons relocate to the United States following the Second World War), served on the boards of the Russian Center of San Francisco and Russian Life Corporation, which published the newspaper Russkaia zhizn'. For over a decade (1954-1965) he served as director of the Museum of Russian Culture, in particular acquiring for it a voluminous amount of material about Russians in China. Loukaskin died in San Francisco on 6 October 1988.

chronitem.event: Appointed director, Muzei Obshchestva izucheniia Man'chzhurskogo kraia, Harbin, China

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: A. S. Loukashkin was a biologist and the director of the Muzei Obshchestva izucheniia Man'chzhurskogo kraia in Harbin, China, and the Museum of Russian Culture in San Francisco, California. He also served on the boards of the Russian Center and Russian Life Corporation, which published the newspaper Russkaia zhizn' (San Francisco, California); two series so named reflect his activities in these organizations. The collection contains a small number of Loukashkin's scientific writings and a large quantity of collected materials on a variety of subjects, primarily Russians in China, the United States, and other countries. The PRINTED MATTER series contains rare issues of Russian émigré periodicals, especially those published in China.

Detailed processing and preservation microfilming for these materials were made possible by a generous grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities and by matching funds from the Hoover Institution and Museum of Russian Culture. The grant also provides depositing a microfilm copy in the Hoover Institution Archives. The original materials remain in the Museum of Russian Culture, San Francisco as its property. A transfer table indicating corresponding box and reel numbers is available at the Hoover Institution Archives.

The Hoover Institution assumes all responsibility for notifying users that they must comply with the copyright law of the United States (Title 17 United States Code) and Hoover Rules for the Use and Reproduction of Archival Materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Articles, poetry and translations, arranged chronologically by title

did.unittitle: Russian Center of San Francisco File,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Charter, clippings, correspondence, financial records, founding documents, legal records, list of members, minutes of meetings, printed matter, and speeches, relating to the activities and functioning of the Russian Center of San Francisco, Inc., and its predecessors - the Russian Club, Russkoe Natsional'noe Ob"edinenie, and others, arranged alphabetically by physical form

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Articles, charter, clippings, correspondence, court records, financial records, minutes of meetings, poster, program, miscellany, arranged alphabetically by physical form, relating to the operations of Russkaia zhizn', published in San Francisco, California

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings, correspondence, writings, and printed matter, arranged alphabetically by subject

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Booklets, clippings, journals, and newspapers, arranged alphabetically by physical form, and therein by author or title

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Newspapers and scrapbooks, arranged alphabetically by physical form, and therein by title (for newspapers) and subject (for scrapbooks)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two albums depicting the construction of the Khukhai Railway, one album depicting events and people associated with the newspaper Russkaia zhizn', 69 loose prints and four negatives, depicting subjects such as the Russian Center of San Francisco, Anna Marly, the 22 nd Invalids' Ball, President Dwight D. Eisenhower with A. S. Loukashkin

odd.head: General note
odd.p: See also RUSSIAN CENTER OF SAN FRANCISCO FILE and RUSSKAIA ZHIZN' FILE for speeches and reports made to the boards of directors and general meetings of members of these organizations, and SUBJECT FILE for Loukashkin's speeches and writings (primarily anniversary notes, polemics, letters to the editor, and similar matter for newspapers) relating to Boy scouts and other subjects of interest to Loukashkin

did.unittitle: Translations of Russian-language articles by others on sardines,
Introduction to N. A. Baikov and I. V. Kozlov, "Ekskursii v dolinu reki Mudan'tszian,"
Introduction to N. N. Gomboev, Man'chzhuria glazami okhotnika,
"Novye ornitologicheskie nakhodki i nekotorye nabliudeniia nad ptitsami Severnoi Man'chzhurii," Vestnik Man'chzhurii,
"The Tarbagan or the Transbaikalian Marmot and Its Economic Value," Comptes rendus du XIIe Congrès international de zoologie, (offprint dated ).
"The Tarbagan or the Transbaikalian Marmot as a Carrier of Plague," Comptes rendus du XIIe Congrès international de zoologie, (offprint dated ).
"Mammals, Collected by the Dalai-Khingan Zoological Expedition of Manchuria Research Institute at Harbin, in 1935," Bulletin of the Institute of Scientific Research, Manchoukuo,
"Mammals found on the Territory of Greater Harbin," Report of the Institute of Scientific Research, Manchoukuo,
"On the Avifauna of North Manchuria," Report of the Institute of Scientific Research, Manchoukuo,
"Fragments on the Question of Natural Food of Some North Manchurian Birds," Report of the Institute for Horse-Diseases,

"The General Report and Diary of the Assistant to the Chief of the Expedition of the Scientific Research Institute in the Region of Wutalienchieh in the Summer of 1937," Bulletin of the Institute of Scientific Research, Manchoukuo,
"On the Pikas of North Manchuria," Journal of Mammalogy,
"On the Hares of Northern Manchuria," Journal of Mammalogy,
"A Preliminary Report on the Behavior of the Pacific Sardine (Sardinops Caerulea) in an Electrical Field, " Proceedings of the California Academy of Sciences,
"Further Studies of the Behavior of the Pacific Sardine (Sardinops Caerulea) in an Electrical Field," Proceedings of the California Academy of Sciences,
"On the Pacific Sardine (Sardinops Caerulea Girard) in Aquaria: Transportation, Handling, Maintenance, and Survival," Proceedings of the California Academy of Sciences,
"Pusanskii gubernator: Svetloi pamiati Dimitriia Gerasimovicha Romanova," .
"K bibliografii dal'nevostochnoi pressy: Studencheskaia pressa Kharbina," Novyi zhurnal,
"Mongol'skie elementy v faune mlekopitaiushchikh v Severnoi Man'chzhurii," Zoologicheskii zhurnal,
RUSSIAN CENTER OF SAN FRANCISCO FILE,

scopecontent.p: Clippings about him and reviews of his books

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings, correspondence, printed matter and writings relating to the history of scouting in pre-Revolutionary Russia and Russian Boy scout organizations abroad following the Revolution, especially in the United States

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Brochures, bulletins and documents on inter-war China, published in Chinese and English in China

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, reports, and other documents relating to the Railway, including a chronology of events prepared for the 25 th anniversary (1922) and summaries of the local and foreign press for 1919

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings on Russian Baptists, Dukhobors, Molokans, and Old Believers in Canada, Russia, the Soviet Union and the United States

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings from Russian émigré newspapers on Japanese-Soviet and Sino-Japanese relations, including the Japanese occupation of Manchuria

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings relating primarily to the history of the Kamchatka Peninsula in the 18 th and 19 th centuries and the founding of Petropavlovsk-na-Kamchatke

did.unittitle: Museum of Russian Culture, San Francisco.

scopecontent.p: Includes draft of by-laws, correspondence, reports and other matter pertaining to the Museum's activities

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

odd.head: General note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings and writings relating to military and naval battles, educational establishments, and training, as well as biographical information on various officers. Includes material on the First World War

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes information about the evacuation of Russians from China following the Second World War, and on displaced persons in general

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The bulk of these clippings, other printed matter, and correspondence, relates to conflicts over the construction of the Russian Orthodox Cathedral on Geary Street, San Francisco, California, in the 1960s

did.unittitle: San Francisco Committee for the Aid of Russian Disabled Veterans Outside of Russia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings of a biographical nature on various individuals, primarily military leaders, involved in the Civil War (A. V. Kolchak, Iu. K. Stark, S. S. Tolstov, P. V. Vologodskii, and others)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relates primarily to the Red Army and Navy in the inter-war period, with a significant volume on the Red Army in the Russian Far East

did.unittitle: Clippings of a biographical nature (predominantly obituaries) on various prominent Russians (mainly military men) active in the first half of the 20 th century.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Indexed file includes materials on Adm. A. V. Kolchak, Gen. A. P. Kutepov, Gen. N. N. Iudenich, Gen. A. A. Vlasov, Prince Felix Iusupov, Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaevich, and others

odd.head: General note
odd.p: see PRINTED MATTER/Clippings, which consists of clippings from various sources not organized by subject
